data.text:
If you’re a fan of Lee Smith’s movies, you’re in for a treat! Our latest article highlights some of his most popular films, exploring their plots, themes, and the impact they’ve left on audiences worldwide. From action-packed thrillers to thought-provoking dramas, we’ve got you covered with this exciting roundup.

As an Amazon Associate, we may earn through qualified purchases.

1. Get Carter (2000)

In the gritty crime thriller “Get Carter” (2000), Sylvester Stallone delivers a chilling performance as a Las Vegas mob enforcer. Following the mysterious death of his brother, he returns to his hometown to unravel the truth. As he dives into the web of deceit and treachery, Stallone’s character relentlessly pursues the truth, leaving a trail of bodies in his wake.

📺 View for free via Amazon Prime

2. 2gether (2000)

Experience the hilarious spoof of boy bands with “2gether”! Directed by Nigel Dick and written by Brian Gunn and Mark Gunn, this comedy follows a group of boy band hopefuls whose journey parallels that of iconic groups like N’Sync, New Kids on the Block, and Backstreet Boys. Think “Spinal Tap” but with a music twist!

👀 View free on Amazon Prime

3. Christy: The Movie (2000)

“Christy: The Movie” (2000) is a heartwarming drama adaptation of Catherine Marshall’s beloved novel. The inspiring story follows Christy, a passionate young woman who moves to a small, tight-knit community to teach in a one-room schoolhouse. Christy’s determination to bring modernity and progress to the town is met with resistance from her neighbors, who fear change and hold fast to their traditions.

📽️ Stream free from Prime

4. The Wedding Dress (2001)

“The Wedding Dress” is a heartwarming drama and romance film that spans across five love stories. The film’s central plot revolves around a custom-made wedding dress that holds a mystical charm. As the dress is passed down through different generations, the magic it possesses weaves a spell that plays a pivotal role in each of the couples’ love stories.

➡️ View now free at Amazon

5. I Want to Marry Ryan Banks (2004)

Get ready to embark on an unforgettable journey filled with love, laughter, and a riveting reality show in “I Want to Marry Ryan Banks” (2004). As a struggling musician, Ryan Banks (Jason Priestley) is thrust into the spotlight when his manager and close friend, Todd (Bradley Cooper), suggests he becomes the bachelor on a sensational reality dating show. The idea is to clean up Ryan’s tarnished image, but nothing goes as planned when the charming and down-to-earth Charlie (Emma Caulfield Ford) captures Ryan’s heart.

➡️ Stream for free at Amazon

6. The Survivors Club (2004)

In “The Survivors Club, “ three fearless friends, Jillian Hayes, Carol Rosen, and Meg Pesaturo, are bound together by a horrifying encounter with a serial killer. After having their lives torn apart by the brutal acts of Eddie Como, the three survivors come together and seek justice. With the help of the media, they force the authorities to take notice and eventually arrest the rapist.

👉 Watch now free with Amazon Prime

7. Art School Confidential (2006)

Immerse yourself in the vibrant realm of “Art School Confidential” (2006), an enthralling masterpiece directed by Terry Zwigoff. This film showcases a captivating fusion of comedy, drama, and romance, chronicling the life of a blossoming artist as he grapples with the intricate layers of the art world. The protagonist’s unwavering passion for art is evident from his early sketches to his enrollment in art school.

👀 Watch free with Amazon Prime

8. One Way (2006)

In the gripping and intense thriller, “One Way, “ a star advertiser must go to extreme lengths to cover up his infidelities and save his upcoming marriage. He sets out to free an accused rapist by providing a false alibi, but his actions have devastating consequences. As the victim takes matters into their own hands to seek brutal revenge, the advertiser finds himself at the heart of a dangerous game.

👉 View now for free @ Amazon

9. The Last Kiss (2006)

“The Last Kiss” is a poignant and heartwarming tale of friendship, love, and the unexpected complications that life can bring. Set in 2006, the film follows the life of Michael, who seemingly has it all: a successful career, a happy relationship, and a close-knit group of friends. However, when he encounters a bubbly college girl, everything changes, and Michael finds himself questioning the predictability of his life.

➡️ Watch now free with Amazon Prime

10. Late Fragment (2007)

“Late Fragment is a groundbreaking interactive film that lets audiences piece together the cinematic narrative, creating a unique experience where viewers click to progress the story sequencing their own events. Directors Daryl Cloran, Anita Doron, and Mateo Guez collaborate with writers Daryl Cloran, Anita Doron, and Mateo Guez to weave a compelling drama filled with child in jeopardy, therapist sessions, teenagers, and striptase performances.

Watch for free at Amazon Prime

11. Trick ‘r Treat (2007)

Celebrate the spookiest holiday of the year with “Trick ‘r Treat, “ an entertaining and terrifying 2007 film that is as delightfully dark as the night itself. This intriguing horror-comedy, directed by Michael Dougherty and written by Dougherty himself, takes place on Halloween and brings to life five interconnected stories filled with delightful surprises. The unexpected encounters — complete with chilling scares — include a high school principal harboring a sinister secret, a hapless group of teenagers finding themselves in over their heads, a woman grappling with her husband’s undying love for all things Halloween, and more.

📺 View now for free via Prime

12. Normal (2007)

The captivating drama, “Normal,” released in 2007, delivers a gripping portrayal of human resilience after a tragic car accident. Brilliantly directed by Carl Bessai and penned by Travis McDonald, this masterpiece follows a group of strangers in mourning as they struggle to cope with the aftermath of their loss.

View now free at Amazon Prime

13. Pathology (2008)

“Pathology” is a chilling journey into the dark world of medical school. A group of ambitious students, led by their charismatic and cunning professor, are determined to prove themselves the best. What starts as a daunting competition evolves into a gruesome game of survival. As their lives become entwined with death, they must navigate the treacherous waters of loyalty, love, and the pursuit of perfection.

📽️ Stream for free on Prime

14. An American Carol (2008)

An American Carol is a heartwarming and engaging comedy-fantasy film that takes a light-hearted look at the importance of patriotism. Directed by David Zucker and written by David Zucker, Myrna Sokoloff, and Lewis Friedman, the movie follows the story of Michael Malone, an anti-American filmmaker with an agenda to abolish the July Fourth holiday.

➡️ Watch now free with Prime

15. Helen (2009)

Helen (2009) is a powerful drama that delves into the complexities of clinical depression and its impact on an individual’s personal and professional life. Directed by Sandra Nettelbeck and written by the same talented creators, the film stars revered actresses Ashley Judd, Goran Visnjic, and Lauren Lee Smith.

👉 Stream for free from Amazon

16. Girl Walks Into a Bar (2011)

In the fast-paced, witty comedy “Girl Walks Into a Bar” (2011), a group of seemingly unconnected individuals navigate their way through a series of intertwining stories set in ten different bars across Los Angeles during a single evening. With a sharp eye for detail and a genuine sense of humor, director Sebastian Gutierrez and writer Sebastian Gutierrez weave together a collection of tales that unravel the complexities of human relationships.

➡️ Watch now free at Amazon Prime

18. Cinemanovels (2013)

Cinemanovels, released in 2013, is a heartwarming and humorous coming-of-age story. The film follows a young woman, who, as she prepares a memorial film retrospective for her late estranged father, discovers that his work has a profound influence on her personal life. This emotional journey, filled with unexpected twists and turns, will leave you both moved and entertained.

👉 View now free from Amazon Prime

19. Hunting Season (2013)

“Hunting Season, “ a chilling 2013 thriller from Inferno Pictures Inc. , delves into a woman’s dark past as she inherits a picturesque countryside home. As the protagonist navigates her newfound inheritance, she soon discovers that her serene retreat is haunted by a malevolent presence from her past.

📽️ View now free @ Amazon

20. If I Stay (2014)

“If I Stay” is a heart-wrenching drama film that transports viewers into the world of young Mia Hall after a devastating car accident leaves her in a coma. As she experiences an out-of-body journey, Mia must confront the reality of waking up to a life vastly dissimilar from what she once knew. Faced with the agonizing decision of carrying on and enduring the pain, the courageous young woman must make a choice that could change the trajectory of her life forever.

📺 View now free from Amazon

21. How to Plan an Orgy in a Small Town (2015)

“How to Plan an Orgy in a Small Town” is a comedic drama that delves into the quirks of a small-town community and the unexpected consequences of their actions. The film follows Cassie Cranston, a sex columnist and former “town slut, “ who returns to her hometown of Beaver’s Ridge for her mother’s funeral.

🎬 Watch now for free at Prime

22. The Shape of Water (2017)

In “The Shape of Water, “ a heartwarming and visually enchanting 2017 film, a mute janitor in a secret 1960s research facility forms a powerful bond with an otherworldly creature. Told through the perspective of the janitor, played by Sally Hawkins, fans of the genre will not want to miss this fantastical tale of love and human connection. Watch as Hawkins navigates through sign language, immerses herself in the underwater world of this magical amphibious creature, and learns the true meaning of empathy and courage.

Watch now free at Amazon Prime

23. The Wedding Ring (2021)

The Wedding Ring, originally titled A Wedding Ring, is a heartwarming romantic comedy that captures the essence of love, longing, and second chances. Set in the vibrant city of Minneapolis, Minnesota, the movie follows the story of Kate, a talented jewelry designer who’s been creating beautiful rings for countless happy couples. However, her own happy ending seems just out of reach when she’s unexpectedly reunited with her childhood sweetheart. As Kate navigates the ups and downs of love and life, she discovers that the most important thing she’s been searching for all along is right in front of her.

➡️ Watch now free with Amazon
